Introduction Java

Term Definition
Class Template used for many things such as constructors, methods, and the 4 pillars
of object oriented programming.
Method Manipulation tool for a application. Use it to change text to uppercase, bubble sort,
and interact with a program. Examples of how I used methods include a grading scale
or to sort an array in a multitude of ways.
Constructor Special type of function called to create an object. It creates objects using arguments
along with variables that have the proper scope within a class.
Try Catch block Way to dictate error messages as well as print errors if you dislike debugging
depending on the circumstance
Database Organized storage with astronomical size used to hold information electronically
or in other words a far more advanced array.
ASP .Net MVC This is a application framework. MVC stands for Model, View, Controller
This framework is a way to simplify complexity to a program. Words can barely
begin to describe how powerful the control it brings to a web application.
SQL Programming language that can be integrated to C# and many other programming
languages to provide the power of CRUD(Create Read Update Delete) to a database.
JSON Standing for Javascript object notation, JSON is a tool to transmit data
to a web application.
XML Another way to transmit data highly overshadowed by JSON. Mostly because JSON uses Javascript and XML doesn't.
Span Very complex array that can point to a multitude of memories.
.
Reflection Way to provide an object blueprint to assemblies, modules, and types
